Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; traces of two added white lines near top of sherd and one added red band at bottom; exterior: painted decoration consisting possibly of a lion (one hind leg remaining) to left; at left, undetermined motif in outline; below, two dilute lines, and band at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 293, no. 916, pl. 122)
CVA Philadelphia II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Fasc. 29, The University Museum Philadelphia II (p. 16, no. E175.C3, pl. 5, no. 1f)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1203) (phase 2)
